Too much to catch up on really...a lot has gone on in the last three months.  It would take a while.

But the important thing is, I'm pretty happy.  :-)

I have a little bit of time before I have to go to school, so I figure I'll update on the things that have been going on lately.  We've actually been rather busy, and it's kind of strange to think that everything has occured in a short week period.  Lately, it seems I've been spending every waking minute with Adam, Heidi and Alex...which is absolutely wonderful.  I'm sure that'll change more or less once we all have schoolwork to worry about, but for the moment we've been attached at the hip.  I'm not sure I've ever really had friends that close before.

Okay, onto events.  Wednesday, Adam, Alex, Heidi and I had a date with Tim from Long Island to play some NHL 2007 preseason games (because we are ridiculous, and are in a rather competitive online hockey tournament...such dorks!), so we met up early to get some dinner and hang out.  We went to Casey's, where we learned that we are all WAY too loud for our own good ("YOU THINK HE'S GAY??").  Sometime mid-way during the meal, Adam divulged the fact that we weren't playing JUST Tim...Schramm, Phil and Sean were also going over Tim's house, and Bo and his brother Zac were also going to be playing a few games.  It was a good time.  I got to talk to Tim, Schramm and Phil via the little headset thing (though they were messing with my head and switching the headset around so I didn't know who I was talking to), and unfortunately I lost every game I played.  :-(  But hopefully I'll get better at this game thing, and that'll change.  :-)

Thursday was Family Dinner night...the very best night there is.  :-D  Heidi, Alex and I went over to Adam's early to help prepare the food, which was going to consist of steak and red potatoes.  We also brought two bottles of red and a bottle of white wine, which was mostly drunk by Heidi and I.  Heidi ended up getting smashed at that point in the night, though I was fine.  Adam ended up accidentally CHARCOALING the damn steak, because he read the directions wrong and set it at 425 degrees when the recipe called for 325.  It tasted okay, though a bit burnt...but the red potatoes were heavenly, and everyone was fighting over them.  Somewhere during the night, Kace sponteneously showed up.

Then Becky and Hillari decided to beg us to go out with them to Shamrocks, since it was 18+ night.  After some convincing, we all decided to go.  Alex, Heidi and I drove home to consolidate into one car and get changed, and then we met back up at Adam's to head over there.  The bar itself was okay, but as Heidi pointed out, there were no attractive guys for her to hit on.  Then Becky decided to drag Heidi and I out onto the dance floor (the shot of soco and lime that I had may have helped), where we danced for a good hour or so.  We were the only ones out there for a LONG time...but it was fun none the less, and I think I actually did okay.  Adam and Kace left early, Alex sat and watched, Heidi accomplished her goal of getting a guy to buy her a drink, some guys bought us an entire tray of jello shots, some guy turned down my offer to dance, and I got somewhat hit on by the bouncer who thought I was only 18.  Yeah.  Good times.

I need a break.  :-)  I'll catch up on the weekend later.

So, the Colts won the superbowl.  Which is spectacular, because we were rooting for them, for no particular reason.

Heidi got to learn a little bit about football, in hopes that she might someday attract a man.  She also discovered that she likes a guy who is into sports.  Something about the yelling at the screen...

The commercials were pretty good too.  The one about the yellow car robot that lost it's job made both me and Heidi rather emotional, and we were literally saying outloud, "Nooooo, don't kill yourself!"  We later couldn't figure out the point in it...but it certainly impacted us.  :-)

Later on in the night, I didn't get much sleep, so I was IMing Alex from across the house until about 5:00 AM.  Everything at that time was extremely funny to me, and he could hear me giggling from my room.  :-D

AND, the drama continues.

Oh yeah, I'm missing parts of Saturday.  First time that's ever happened.

QUOTES OF THE DAY:

We should have our own cooking show, Heidi and I.  Not because it would be educational or informative, but because it would be extremely funny.  For our family dinner, we decided to make garlic chicken with red potatoes and corn.  Here's a list of the things that went wrong.

*Heidi wrote down the ingredients for the red potatoes, and then lost the recipe.
*We bought a can of corn, but then realized that we had broken our can opener, so we had to open the corn by punching holes around the edge.  I wish I had a picture of it to share...it's halarious.
*Heidi accidentally broke a glass into our potatoes
*I knocked over a bottle of wine, managed to save most of the wine, but in the process broke the glass I was holding.  Shows where my priorities are.
*Heidi knocked over her wine glass over dinner while gesticulating rather wildly
*Our potatoes were dry becuase we forgot to add olive oil into the mixture

Overall, it was rather entertaining.  Heidi figures that we need to cook while buzzed, because otherwise it is way too stressful for us.  Thankfully, Adam is cooking family dinner NEXT time...I'm sure it will be vastly better.

Oh, and we played some NHL at Adam's later.  Such a fun game.

For my first week back at school, it was a lot of fun.  :-)

There was the car show on Friday, where I got to think about what kind of car I'd like to buy next year, and also where Ken's car wouldn't start.  Luckily we had Kevin on our side, who's a handyman and can fix just about anything.

Then Saturday I spent in Narragansett with Heidi, going "party hopping"...or rather, hitting up two parties, but that's pretty intense for us.  We went to the Mews with Adam and his friends Tim, Phil (my "date"), Sean, and Kace for Sean's 21st birthday.  We ordered him a rack of beer to celebrate the occasion, but Adam and I ended up drinking most of it anyways.  I also managed not to recongize Phil, even though I had already met him, and it was at the resteraunt that Heidi decided that he looked like Superman.  (We made him put on fake glasses and tear them off dramatically just to prove it.)

After the Mews we stopped by Adam's house to play some video games and wait until 10, when we planned to go stop by Heidi's friend Casey's house.  We only ended up staying for about a half an hour...and got rather lost tryingn to get there too...because the party was kind of small, and we didn't know very many of the people there.  And most of the action was going on in the basement, where there was beer pong, and it was cold.  After a short visit we headed back to Adam's house, where the video games had stopped, for the most part.  They too were playing beer pong.  A couple of shots later, I was participating, with Phil as my partner, against Kace and Adam.  We were doing awesome at first...but inevidably lost.  Oh well.

At some point or another we all crashed on various couches to watch Jackass II, which now has become one of Heidi's obsessions.  We left shortly after that, though we met up with them the next morning for breakfast at Friendlies.  We watched some Shark show at Adam's house later, and eventually all broke up around 5:00.  The boys (and Kace) had to head back to Long Island (sad :-().

But overall, it was a lot of fun, and I hope those guys come and visit again soon... :-)

My friends and I are insane.  My girl friends and I, anyways.

Not because we go out and party and are wild.  (That only happens every once in a while.)  No, we are insane because the things that we do for "fun" make our parents laugh because it's so ridiculously tame.

Last night for instance.  The night started off at Walmart, doing some back to school shopping.

We progressed to the mall, where we wandered about while Kristin bought some clothes until we met up with Shaina.  Then we sat around on a bench discussing our "type" of guys, until we realized that we were being very Sex-and-the-City like.  (I'm Samantha.  Not because I'm a ho, but because, according to my girls, guys apparently like me.)

Then we went to Panera for dinner, where we managed to sit for 2 hours.  Panera made me very happy and giggly though.  It was a very positive atmosphere.

We eventually moved over to our "hang-out spot", Borders, to browse books, obviously, and do what else?  Sit around and talk.

Once we got tired of that place, we decided to sit around and talk at the tavern, perhaps in hopes that people would show up and the night would get interesting, but they didn't.  We did hang out with Ryan White though, which is always a plus.

Anyways, half of my friends are leaving to go back to school very soon, so the crazy times may be over for now.

So New Year's Eve ended up being a lot of fun.  Confusing, yes.  Complicated, yes, but if we didn't make it complicated, well then it just wouldn't be my group of friends.  So maybe we changed plans about a billion times before New Year's Eve...but it turned out well in the end.  :-)

Originally we were going to go to the casino...but the fact that there was a 100 dollar cover charge for all bars and the fact that both casinos were expecting upwards of 10,000 people made us think twice.  We opted to instead stay in at Samantha's house and hang out...which is fine, because we always manage to have fun when all of us get together.

The group was small...just me, Ken, Sam, Kit, Shay, Anj, and Mike (hmmm...Mike is the only one without a nickname) all hanging out in Sam's basement with pizza, chips, chocolate, and a bunch of alcohol (mostly compliments of Ken and I).  Anj was already smashed by the time we got there (at 7:30, silly girl, but I do love her so), and it mostly ended up being me, Sam and Anj drinking at all...Ken and Mike, as per ushe, just had a few drinks, and Kit and Shay barely drank at all.  It was fine though...we all just ended up talking about random things and playing Scene It: TV (which was really hard and only included super old TV shows and we hated it) and Taboo (which was awesome, and I kick ass at that game, and my team totally won both times).

We stayed up until like 3:00, when we all decided to go to sleep...Mike went home, Sam crashed in her bed upstairs, Shay slept on the floor, Anj and Kit took the pull out couch, and Ken and I squeezed on a one-person blow up couch...it was very reminscent of my junior year in the old house, where me and Ken nightly slept on my twin-sized bed.  :-D  We ate donuts and chatted extensively in the morning, and Ken and I left by 2:00 so we could come home and hang out with Kevin (who we did see) and Christina (who we didn't).

So maybe this week and weekend have been hectic, and maybe yesterday was the first day I got to sit still for the first time in a while.  And maybe I have no more money because of gas, food, parties, and other important things.  But man...it was a fun week.  I actually got out and did stuff.  And hung out with friends.  Which makes me happy.

The craziness started on Thursday, when I drove to meet Ken and Nick at Tuesday's for dinner.  It was Anjali's birthday, and somehow I decided that it would be a good idea to drive the hour down to Mohegan Sun to visit her and Kit.  Well, to my surprise, it WAS a good idea.  Ken came, and we had a great time.  I hadn't seen them in forever.  We wandered around, got some ice cream, looked at some shops, and Ken got all protective whenever guys were acting sketchy to us.  It was unbelievably cute.  Then on Friday I went home, got my hair cut, and saw Sam and Kit this time...we went to dinner and got some Starbucks, and somehow decided that we're going on a trip to DC in May with all of the girls.  What fun.

I had to get back Friday night so I could pick up Heidi for our meeting on Saturday morning with our new landlord.  (Yay!  We have a house now!  I get to live with my HK again!  And with Alex!  WOOHOO!  I'm not gonna live on the street!)  Also, so that we could go out to birthday dinner at the Mews with Troy, Alex, Sara, and Ken, since it was Heidi's birthday.  Although we waited an hour, the food was good, and it was nice to be able to hang out with everybody.  Once we got back, we all dressed up in crazy creepy black clothes for the Heaven and Hell party...which me and Ken only went for a few hours of, cause he had work the next morning, but HK and Sara didn't get back till 4 AM.  Tisk tisk.  ;-)

And now i get to go to lunch with the regular lunch crew... (last wednesday we sat at the dining hall for 2 straight hours...)  It's nice to see friends.  As much as I love Ken, it's really important that I get to see them too, or else I begin to get depressed and sad.  Also, now that the weather is getting nicer, my spirits are picking up.  Nothing is better than some sunshine.  :-)

See!  This is why I tell you about my dreams!

They are vastly more interesting.

So lately, fishbowls and aquariums and aquatic things have been floating around in my dreams.  In particular, this certain aquarium that has appeared in my dreams twice now.  It's a dark aquarium that completely surrounds you...the ceiling and everything are part of the aquarium.   And the aquarium is completely filled with HUGE, enormous creatures.  It's all super-large animals.  Giant squid, giant jellies, giant octopus, giant fish, giant sharks...even a giant frog.  They are awe-inspiring, yet scary at the same time, because a giant jelly fish is obviously quite frightening.

In the first dream, me and Ken are walking around the aquarium, and I'm so impressed, and he's not.  Then some lady with a gun walks in and goes crazy, and the security guards try to get her out, but in the struggle, she shoots the aquarium wall twice.  Water starts flooding in and everyone is running and screaming, not only because they don't wnat to drown, but becuase they don't want to get squashed by a giant squid.

In the second dream, I'm showing Heidi the aquarium.  I'm alone in the aqurium at first, completely in awe by all of the creatures.  I run out to get Heidi, because I want to show her all of these magnificent, over-sized animals.  So I bring her in, yet all of the giant animals are hiding somehow, and she's not very impressed.

Wonder what it all means, and why I have a obsession with giant squid, and other large, frightening, aquatic animals?

In movie tradition, these are my top 10 movies of 2004.

<U> The Top 10 Films of 2004! </U>

10) SPIDERMAN 2: A very good action movie, perhaps best than the first.  Because it is focused around Peter's internal struggle, it's the superhero movies for people who don't like superhero movies.
9) INCREDIBLES: Pixar does it again; it is both funny and profound.  It deals with a lot of adult issues as well, so anybody can enjoy it.  Plus, I like movies with powers.  It's fun.
8) KILL BILL 2:  For those of you who enjoy gratuitous violence and loved Kill Bill 1, you may have found this movie dissapointing.  It was drastically less violent but was vastly superior in plot and story line.  Not to mention Bill and her Sensei are awesome!
7) PHANTOM OF THE OPERA: Absolutly beautiful.  An accurate and well-told movie version of the play; the singing is superior, and the Phantom makes you love and hate him at the same time.  Direction and visuals were astounding.  Those who loved the play will be pleased.
6) RAY: Don't get me wrong, I really loved this movie.  The acting on Jamie Foxx's part was certainly award-winning, and the directing was very good.  For a 3 hour long movie, it only got tedious in the last half an hour.
5) GARDEN STATE: A very hip movie with an excellent soundtrack and a very simple but charming story.  Braff and Portman are at their best.
4) ETERNAL SUNSHINE OF A SPOTLESS MIND: This movie will make your head spin.  It's very intense and original, in the directors style, but is at the same time a charming and thought provoking love story.
3) HERO: The visuals and cinemetography in this movie are...breathtaking.  Jet Li actually does a decent acting job although he is second to the other three samurai in this film.  A complicated and involved story, but very interesting.
2) FINDING NEVERLAND: I really loved this story.  It's so simple, totally innocent, full of imagination and magic.  Johnny Depp's acting is subtle but touching.
1) AVIATOR: A three hour long movie where I wasn't bored for a single instant.  I was literally on the edge of my seat at certain points, and was totally involved in this story of Howard Hughes.  Scorcese and Dicaprio deserve Oscars.  Wonderful.

<U> Honorable Mentions: </U> Napoleon and Sideways.  NAPOLEON DYNAMITE was excellent as an independent, little known film but it gained a lot of random popularity and now it's a "in" thing and that makes it not so fun.  And SIDEWAYS was really, really good and I definitly liked it but I didn't feel very much during the course of the movie except for hatred for one of the characters and pity for the others, so although I appreciated how this movie could be meaningful and great to some people, it's affect was minimal on me.  TERMINAL was also an excellent movie, both sweet and moving, but it was forgettable.
